subject: Re: [junit] How to write test cases for Server side Utility Classes??
msgSnippet: For your simple scenario, I would recommend junitee: http://www.junitee.org/ You write a normal junit test as if it was local and junitee will let you run it
messageBody:
For your simple scenario, I would recommend junitee:

http://www.junitee.org/

You write a normal junit test as if it was local
and junitee will let you run it remotely. It has a
nice browser interface which lets you select which
test(s) you want to run and shows you the result.

Paul.
